text.style: font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;font-weight:bold;font-stretch:normal;font-size:27.5px;line-height:125%;font-family:'Linux Biolinum Keyboard O';-inkscape-font-specification:'Linux Biolinum Keyboard O Bold';text-align:start;letter-spacing:0px;word-spacing:0px;writing-mode:lr-tb;text-anchor:start;opacity:0.88999999;fill:#000000;fill-opacity:1;stroke:none;stroke-width:1px;stroke-linecap:butt;stroke-linejoin:miter;stroke-opacity:1

tspan.style: font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;font-weight:bold;font-stretch:normal;font-size:27.5px;font-family:'Linux Biolinum Keyboard O';-inkscape-font-specification:'Linux Biolinum Keyboard O Bold'
font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;font-weight:bold;font-stretch:normal;font-size:27.5px;font-family:'Linux Biolinum Keyboard O';-inkscape-font-specification:'Linux Biolinum Keyboard O Bold'
font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;font-weight:bold;font-stretch:normal;font-size:27.5px;font-family:'Linux Biolinum Keyboard O';-inkscape-font-specification:'Linux Biolinum Keyboard O Bold'

flowRoot.flowPara: Wide-coverage grammars contain thousands of rules
CG has no internal mechanism to ensure consistency
Internal conflict: e.g. non-existent tag combination or ambiguity class.
Apply the rules to a symbolic sentence: every cohort contains every possible reading.
We can ask the SAT-solver "Is there a sentence where r2 can apply after r1?"
For more info, check our paper "Constraint Grammar as a SAT-problem"
Is there a set of values for the variables x, y and z that satisfies the given formulas?
See details in the paper! 799 @ LREC proceedings
Effect on grammar accuracy before/after cleanup
